greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of compositions of n into exactly k distinct parts.
comment: Same as A072574, with zeros dropped. [_Joerg Arndt_, Oct 20 2012]
Row n contains A003056(n) = floor((sqrt(8*n+1)-1)/2) terms (number of terms increases by one at each triangular number).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..500, flattened
B. Richmond and A. Knopfmacher, Compositions with distinct parts, Aequationes Mathematicae 49 (1995), pp. 86-97.
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..floor((sqrt(8*n+1)-1)/2)), n=1..24);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 12 2012
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Sep 12 2012
